escjava.plugin
Class EscjavaUtils

java.lang.Object
  escjava.plugin.EscjavaUtils

public class EscjavaUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This is a collection of miscellaneous utility functions.

Author:
David Cok

installSpecsUsingProject

public static void installSpecsUsingProject(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject javaProject,
                                            java.lang.String specsProjectName)
If there is not already a project by the given name (the value of specsProjectName) on the classpath of the given project, then add the project to the classpath of 'javaProject'.

Parameters:
javaProject - The project whose classpath is adjusted
specsProjectName - The project that is added to the classpath

installSpecsAsProject

public static boolean installSpecsAsProject(java.lang.String projectName,
                                            java.lang.String folderName,
                                            java.lang.String location)
Create, if it does not already exist, a Java project with the given name containing a source folder with the given name that links to the given location. The source folder is entirely excluded from being built but is on the classpath.

Parameters:
projectName - The name of the Java project to create
folderName - The name of the source folder in the project
location - The location (absolute file-system location path) of the specifications to link to
Returns:
true if the project already existed, false otherwise

isSpecsInstalled

public static boolean isSpecsInstalled(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject javaProject)
Checks to see whether the given project has the JML system specs on its classpath.

Parameters:
javaProject - The project to check
Returns:
true if the system specs are on the classpath, false otherwise

installDefaultSpecs

public static void installDefaultSpecs(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject javaProject)
This method checks to see if the given Java project has the JML specs linked into it. If not, then a jmlspecs project containing the JML system and model specs is created, if it does not already exist. Finally, the jmlspecs project is added to the classpath of the given project.

Parameters:
javaProject - the project to which we wish to add the jmlspecs project.

findInternalSimplify

public static java.lang.String findInternalSimplify(java.lang.String os)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
Finds the simplify executable that is part of the the plugin.

Parameters:
os - The name of the OS
Returns:
The location of the simplify executable as an absolute file system path.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getSimplifySuffix

public static java.lang.String getSimplifySuffix(java.lang.String osname)
